titles.title: APPEAL Act
APPEAL Act
Assigning Proper Placement of Executive Action Lawsuits Act
Assigning Proper Placement of Executive Action Lawsuits Act

To amend title 28, United States Code, to provide exclusive original jurisdiction to the United States District Court for the District of Columbia of certain cases relating to the powers of the Executive, and for other purposes.
APPEAL Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet.

committee.subcommittee: Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary:
Assigning Proper Placement of Executive Action Lawsuits Act or the APPEAL Act
This bill provides exclusive original jurisdiction to the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia for cases regarding an executive order, action, or memorandum.
